body_html: @timmeinhardt IMO, one shouldn't rely on assumption that RNG state shouldn't change during some code. It would be much better if you just save the state before the val run, and load it afterwards. Using seeds also works.
body_text: @timmeinhardt IMO, one shouldn't rely on assumption that RNG state shouldn't change during some code. It would be much better if you just save the state before the val run, and load it afterwards. Using seeds also works.
body: @timmeinhardt IMO, one shouldn't rely on assumption that RNG state shouldn't change during some code. It would be much better if you just save the state before the val run, and load it afterwards. Using seeds also works.
